channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Celebrating the life and career of NPR 'founding mother' and arts champion Susan Stamberg
item.description: NPR's Susan Stamberg was a longtime champion of visual arts coverage, but she had to invent new ways to do it on the radio.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Susan Stamberg was a longtime champion of visual arts coverage, but she had to invent new ways to do it on the radio.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: How GOP officials are responding to leaked racist messages from Young Republicans
item.description: Republican leaders are responding to a Politico report that exposed racist messages shared by Young Republican organizations in Kansas, New York, Arizona and Vermont.
item.content:encoded: Republican leaders are responding to a Politico report that exposed racist messages shared by Young Republican organizations in Kansas, New York, Arizona and Vermont.
item.dc:creator: Zane Irwin

item.title: Trump says he's moving his Venezuelan cartel fight from sea to land. What does that mean?
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks to Pentagon correspondent Tom Bowman and Justice correspondent Ryan Lucas about another deadly U.S. strike on an alleged drug boat off the coast of Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks to Pentagon correspondent Tom Bowman and Justice correspondent Ryan Lucas about another deadly U.S. strike on an alleged drug boat off the coast of Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: As the dead are returned to Israel and Gaza, relatives try to give them dignified burials
item.description: As laid out in the first phase of President Trump's peace plan, Israel and Hamas are now releasing bodies of Israelis and Palestinians killed during the war. In Israel, funerals are taking place daily as families get closure, but in Gaza such burials will be much more challenging.
item.content:encoded: As laid out in the first phase of President Trump's peace plan, Israel and Hamas are now releasing bodies of Israelis and Palestinians killed during the war. In Israel, funerals are taking place daily as families get closure, but in Gaza such burials will be much more challenging.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Is the AI boom an AI bubble?
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Jared Bernstein, a Stanford University economist who was once chief economic adviser to President Biden, on a potential artificial intelligence bubble in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Jared Bernstein, a Stanford University economist who was once chief economic adviser to President Biden, on a potential artificial intelligence bubble in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Brianna Scott

item.title: American farmers are hurting. Trump's trade war is making it worse
item.description: Farmers are struggling this fall despite a bountiful harvest. Production costs are high, crop prices are low and the trade war has closed off one of their biggest markets.
item.content:encoded:
Farmers are struggling this fall despite a bountiful harvest. Production costs are high, crop prices are low and the trade war has closed off one of their biggest markets.

(Image credit: Illinois Soybean Association)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: The latest layoffs at HUD target fair housing investigators around the U.S.
item.description: The latest shutdown layoffs at HUD target fair housing investigators around the country. Critics say that'll make it hard to enforce the fair housing laws Congress has passed.
item.content:encoded: The latest shutdown layoffs at HUD target fair housing investigators around the country. Critics say that'll make it hard to enforce the fair housing laws Congress has passed.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Trump talks with Putin ahead of hosting Zelenskyy at the White House
item.description: President Trump's views on Russia and Ukraine seem to be shifting ahead of Volodymyr Zelenskyy's visit to the White House.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's views on Russia and Ukraine seem to be shifting ahead of Volodymyr Zelenskyy's visit to the White House.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Humans of New York founder remembers Stephanie 'Tanqueray' Johnson
item.description: Stephanie "Tanqueray" Johnson made viral history on the Humans of New York Instagram account. She died at 81 years old recently.
item.content:encoded: Stephanie "Tanqueray" Johnson made viral history on the Humans of New York Instagram account. She died at 81 years old recently.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith

item.title: Here's how to eliminate, reduce or negotiate a medical bill
item.description: There's an estimated $195 billion of medical debt in America. But just because a medical bill comes in the mail doesn't mean you have to pay that exact price.
item.content:encoded: There's an estimated $195 billion of medical debt in America. But just because a medical bill comes in the mail doesn't mean you have to pay that exact price.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra
